name: Chia Pudding
description: Overnight refrigerator pudding, healthy and filling. Omega-3 and fiber powerhouse.

instructions.instruction: In medium bowl, combine chia seeds, almond milk, yogurt, honey, and vanilla.
Whisk thoroughly with fork or whisk. Chia seeds shouldn't clump.
instructions.tip: Stir a few times within first 5 minutes - prevents clumping.

instructions.instruction: Divide mixture between two jars or deep bowls.
instructions.tip: Mason jars are ideal for transport.

instructions.instruction: Cover with lids or plastic wrap.
Refrigerate at least 4 hours, ideally overnight.
instructions.tip: Chia seeds absorb liquid and become gel-like.

instructions.instruction: Before serving, remove puddings from fridge and stir.
Check consistency - if too thick, add a bit more milk and stir.
instructions.tip: Ideal consistency is like thick yogurt.

instructions.instruction: Top with blueberries, banana slices, and almonds.

instructions.tip: Add granola at last moment to keep it crunchy.

tips: Chia seeds are rich in omega-3, fiber, and protein.
Prep 5 portions at start of week - ready breakfast every morning.
Liquid to chia ratio: About 3 tbsp liquid per 1 tbsp chia.
For vegan, skip yogurt and use coconut milk.
storageInfo: Refrigerate in airtight container up to 5 days. Add fruit fresh.
servingSuggestion: Eat for breakfast, afternoon snack, or pre-workout energy.
variations: Tropical: Use coconut milk, mango, and pineapple.
Add peanut butter for more satiety.
